thread.title: Bridgewater golfer from Williamsburg earns ODAC honor after third individual title in a row
thread.title_full: Bridgewater golfer from Williamsburg earns ODAC honor after third individual title in a row

title: Bridgewater golfer from Williamsburg earns ODAC honor after third individual title in a row
text:
Bridgewater golfer from Williamsburg earns ODAC honor after third individual title in a row Compiled by Daily Press 
COLLEGES: 
Women's golf: 
Bridgewater’s Christina Herbert was named the Old Dominion Athletic Conference Golfer of the Week following two individual victories in the past seven days. 
Herbert, a sophomore from Jamestown High, is on a streak not seen in the short history of ODAC women’s golf. She won both tournaments in which Bridgewater competed this week, giving her three individual medals in her three starts this season. 
She has earned four individual medals in a row, dating back to her first-place finish at the 2015 ODAC championships. 
Herbert won the Generals Invitational at 7-over-par 151, beating Washington and Lee’s Liza Freed by one stroke at Lexington Golf & Country Club. BC placed second as a team, six shots behind W&L. 
Herbert’s second win of the week came at the Bridgewater Fall Invitational, where she shot a 5-over 149 at Lakeview Golf Club. She leads the ODAC with an average of 74 strokes per round. 
Football: 
William and Mary returned to both FCS national rankings, grabbing the No. 24 spots in the Stats and coaches’ polls after winning at then-No. 14 Villanova. 
Men's tennis: 
Virginia junior Thai-Son Kwiatkowski captured the Intercollegiate Tennis Asssociation All-American Championships' singles title and won the doubles title with senior Mac Styslinger in Tulsa, Okla. 
Kwiatkowski became the first player since 2009 and fourth in tournament history to win the singles and doubles championships in the same year. Kwiatkowski, the No. 3 seed in the singles draw, toppled No. 4 Dominik Koepfer of Tulane 6-0, 6-2. 
In the doubles championship, Kwiatkowski and Styslinger outlasted ACC foes Brett Clark and Robert Kelly of North Carolina 3-6, 6-2, 1-0 (10-7). 
Kwiatkowski gave U.Va. a sweep of the ITA All-American singles titles. Senior Danielle Collins won the women's crown the previous day in Pacific Palisades, Calif. 
Field hockey: 
Tufts (8-3) ranked 16th in Division III, edged No. 14 Christopher Newport 2-1 in Medford, Mass., on a late goal. 
Rachael Allshouse’s goal gave CNU (9-2) a 1-0 halftime lead, but the Jumbos evened the score in the 43rd minute on Maggie Chapman’s goal. Dakota Sikes-Keilp scored the winner on a penalty corner after time expired. 
Men's golf: 
Christopher Newport took the first-round lead by one stroke over Ferrum in the Ted Keller Memorial tournament, shooting a 13-over-par 293 at Hanover Country Club in the Richmond area. 
The Captains were led by David Rabil's 2-under 68 and Matt DiSalvo's even-par 70. They enter the final day tied for first and third, respectively, in the individual standings. 
Rabil, who shares the lead with Franklin & Marshall's Brad Lankler, missed tying CNU's freshman record by one stroke. It is held by set by Joseph Evans and Chris Kline. 
Women’s golf: 
W&M shot 291, the second-best round score in school history, to stand sixth among 20 teams after one round of the Pinehurst Challenge in North Carolina. 
Women's basketball: 
Rachel Allen, a former four-year starter at point guard for Division I Tennessee State, joined holdover Brooke Long as assistants to CNU coach Bill Broderick. 
Last season, Allen set Tennessee State's single-season record with 155 assists and led the Tigers to the NCAA tournament. 
Broderick, 70-18 in three years with CNU, and his team begin practice Thursday. 
Men's soccer: 
Christopher Newport's Sean Christein, a Tabb High graduate, was named the Capital Athletic Conference Defensive Player of the Week for the second time in three weeks. 
He guided 10th-ranked CNU's defense in a 3-0 win against Southern Virginia, in which he scored the first goal, and in a scoreless draw at Southern Virginia. 
Women's soccer: 
CNU sophomore goalkeeper Carly Maglio was named the CAC Defensive Player of the Week after leading the Captains to two league wins. 
She became the third Captain this season to be named Defensive Player of the Week. 

LOCAL TENNIS: 
Kwmane Tonkins, Denis Liu and Joe Coccimiglio earned singles titles in the weekend Octoberfest Tennis Classic, a Peninsula Tennis Patrons Association tournament on Huntington Park's hard courts in Newport News. 
Tonkins, a left-hander who starred for Heritage High and Virginia State, beat David Loope 6-2, 6-4 in the men's 4.5 final for his third victory of the tournament. 
Liu, a York High player competing at 4.0, scored all three of his weekend victories in match tiebreaks after splitting sets. The last of those triumphs was 7-5, 2-6, 1-0 (10-8) against Ron Morrison. 
Coccimiglio, from Poquoson, edged York's Rishit Patel 4-6, 6-1, 1-0 (10-6) in the 3.5 final. 
Jim Dempsey and Tsuneo Kageya edged Liu and Jonathan Moulton 5-7, 6-4, 1-0 (10-4) for the 4.0 doubles championship.
